intro: Armarintea morisonii, commonly known as the Morrison's armarintea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and palmate leaflets, which are adaptations to its humid habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
